core_exploration.central_question: How do we embody and live our mythic stories rather than just tell them?
core_exploration.key_tension: The contradiction between verbal storytelling and somatic embodiment of narrative
core_exploration.breakthrough_moment: Recognition that stories can be experienced through movement and presence rather than words
core_exploration.edge_of_understanding: The full implications of what happens when myths become lived experience rather than told tales

conceptual_dna: Stories exist in the body through movement and seeing, not just in words
Mythic transformation requires embodied participation, not passive listening
Creative constraints with consequences can unlock deeper forms of expression

bridge_potential.novel_synthesis: Combining mythic storytelling with embodied movement practice and playful constraint-based learning
bridge_potential.cross_domain_pattern: Transformation through embodied constraint rather than intellectual understanding

raw_essence: True mythic storytelling happens not through words but through embodied movement and presence. By creating playful constraints that force us beyond verbal expression, we can access deeper layers of narrative that live in our bodies and transform us from passive listeners into active participants in our own becoming.
embedding_text: embodied storytelling mythic transformation somatic narrative movement presence constraint-based learning playful consequences body wisdom non-verbal expression ritual performance
